title: First League of Herzeg-Bosnia
text:
The First League of Herzeg-Bosnia served as the top <a href="association%20football">football</a> league in <a href="Croatian%20Republic%20of%20Herzeg-Bosnia">Croatian Republic of Herzeg-Bosnia</a> during the <a href="Bosnian%20War">Bosnian War</a> and post-war periods of the 1990s. During these years, football was divided along ethnic lines, with the <a href="Croat">Croat</a>, <a href="Bosniaks">Bosniak</a> and <a href="Serb">Serb</a> populations each running their own league. Because Bosniaks were the only group interested in a distinctly Bosnian-Herzegovinian league and <a href="Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina%20national%20football%20team">national team</a>, only their league was recognized by the <a href="Football%20Association%20of%20Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina">Football Association of Bosnia and Herzegovina</a>.
The league formed in 1993. In the 1997/1998 season, the top Croat teams began facing the top Bosniak teams for entrance to <a href="UEFA">UEFA</a> tournaments, something that had been denied the Herzeg-Bosnia league on its own. This setup lasted until the 2000/2001 season when the two leagues merged to form the <a href="Premier%20League%20of%20Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina">Premier League of Bosnia and Herzegovina</a>.
